note.p: Education: The Fund Academy (a Dissenting college), London. DD (1756, Glasgow)

Career: Preacher to various dissenting congregations; wrote 'Review of the principal questions in morals' (1756); 'An appeal to the public on the subject of the National Debt' (1769); intimate friend of Benjamin Franklin and Joseph Priestley
References: William P Griffith, 'Priestley in London' in NR 1983-84 vol 38 pp 1-16
Bernard Bailyn, '1776: The British Dimension' in NR 1976-7 vol 31 pp 179-199
J D Holland, 'An Eighteenth-Century Pioneer - Richard Price, DD, FRS (1723-1791)' in NR 1968 vol 23 pp 43-64, plate
